page.title: 02Our Domesday Walk
page.content: We set of from Kilsby on our circular walk. We had to mark all the stiles, bridges and gates on our map.We came to a kissing gate which led to a big echo bridge. As we left Mrs Sparks put her foot in the mud. After stopping in the park at Barby we carried on to the end of ridge passing an unidentified, very big, concrete block, and then went down the hill, past an enormous bull, to the Oxford Canal. From the ridge you could see Onley Prison, but it looked like a holiday camp with soccer pitches. We saw quite a few barges .By one bridge we found an electric fence. We tried touching it. We also tried it when you hold hands. It really hurts. We had dinner by the canal then went across several big fields. We walked passed Lysanders farm and back along the A5. We passed Kilsby tunnel to end
